comment.author: 53227388@N00
comment._content: I think the geolocation on the map might be out. This bridge is over the Boyne, but the one indicated in the map is over the Blackwater. I think this bridge is Athlumney Bridge, which now carries the R153 (you can get a look at the environs in Google Street View - not quite as bucolic anymore). Picture here from a different angle: www.flickr.com/photos/63061621@N05/5739721946/

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/woesinger] You're absolutely right! My apologies, I was in rather a rush when uploading - but I always know the Flickr bunch will spot, and thankfully point out any anomalies - nicer word for mistakes.  :)  Now amended.
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment._content: Wonder if this view still exists today?

comment.author: 66841851@N00
comment._content: Here's the spot on google maps. The church in the background of the picture is in behind those houses to the right although alas the thatched house on the right and the factory with the big chimney on the back left seem to be gone now. g.co/maps/h63dm
